these are not gonna do it I need something better oh hey guys welcome
back to Blackmagic craft all this elaborate Frost grave stuff that I've
made to make a really immersive game and I'm using these little green wooden
beads as treasure tokens that ends today let's make something way friggin better
this was meant to be a simple and fast
project but I encountered my first obstacle immediately these tokens needed
basis so I dug through my collection of plastic bases and was only able to find
a couple that were the size I wanted I wanted these to be small tokens and I
only had a few plastic ones that size a trip to the store just to find something
that would work would delay the start of the project by a few hours so instead I
dug around the house trying to find an alternative this was one of those times
where I wish I dealt with cash more and had some change on hand as pennies or
dimes would have been fine in the end I found some small washers the size of
these were perfect but the hole in the middle well that would be a bit of a
problem I decided to prime them before doing anything this way whatever I used
to fill the holes would adhere better than it would to just raw metal while
the primer dried I started digging through my collection of bits to find
appropriate items to act as the treasure I wanted these tokens to be more
accurate to the game than just big piles of gold the treasure you collect in
frost grave are things like books scrolls potions gold and the odd weapon
somatically and mechanically giant piles of gold and treasure items don't make
sense so for each token I chose one or two
small items relics the warband could conceivably find in the melting snow and
actually carry out of battle most of what I found came from antics
terrain crate sets as they are full of great little pieces but I also used a
few whiz kids items that I had on hand to really get the small individual
pieces looking right I actually ended up cutting up some of the already small
scalps into tinier portions to fill the holes in the washers and create little
mounds for the treasure to sit in I use some milliput I wanted to make sure it
bonded well so I tried applying some super glue to the washers while putting
on the milliput this was a nightmare it didn't work it was messy and sticky and
I stopped that idea after like the first try and just moved on without it with
the milliput still soft I placed my pieces of treasure I needed a few more
items than I thought so I grabbed some leftover accessories from a sprue of
frost grave soldier minis these sets are awesome because they leave you with so
many usable leftover bits I spray primed everything black and I didn't even wait
for the milliput to cure I was pretty sure this would be fine but I didn't
know so just in case I reached out ask some of my fellow creators and Trent for
a miscast said yeah it was fine he had done this before yeah it's fine I've
done it before so I gave it a go and I primed uncured Millepied then I realized
shortly after that black primer was a silly choice considering the majority of
the tokens would end up as white snow I batch painted these as quickly and
efficiently as possible blocking out a bunch of the same color across the set
to save time
despite doing a fast paint job I did however go through the effort of using
several different washes right cleanse flesh egg rocks earth shade Nolan oil
wherever they were the most appropriate
after the washes I did do a minimal amount of highlighting mostly focusing
on the bottles as I wanted them to at least look a little bit like glass I
wasn't happy with the way the labels I had painted were looking but then I
remembered something that was in my garbage can from the previous project
the aged paper from the bulletin board would make perfect little labels I cut
out small squares that contained a tiny bit of image or text and using some
gloss Mod Podge I added them to the bottles
I chose gloss Mod Podge for this because well it's the only Mod Podge I own that
isn't pre-mixed with black paint and a little bit of gloss on the bottles
wouldn't hurt I feel quite pleased with myself for thinking of this little
detail before applying my snow texture I painted out the remainder of the bases
in white and I just used basic flat white craft paint for this this would
give some room for error if my snow flocking didn't cover everything for the
actual snow I used a bit of snow flocking from green stuff WorldCom mixed
with watered-down PVA glue to create a snow paste that I could apply with a
sculpting tool this creates a really wonderful effect that is also incredibly
durable once dried it's like cement and it won't be constantly falling off using
a paste like this also allowed me to give the impression the treasure was
partially buried in the snow and the snow flocking would blend in perfectly
with the portion of my boards that had this
same material this project was really easy but it was also super fun sometimes
it's really refreshing to just make something out of pre-made bits instead
of trying to sculpt everything yourself these pieces turned out great and
they're really practical and they will perfectly suit my terrain if you want to
grab any tools or supplies and support the channel in the process consider
doing your shopping through my essential equipment page on Blackmagic craft CA
there it lists all of the stuff that I use and that I love so you get the right
items and I earn a small commission through the affiliate links to help fund
the production of videos like this if you enjoyed the work that I do for the
community and you get a lot of value out of it you can help ensure that I can
keep doing it by supporting Blackmagic crafts on patreon I'd love to have you
as the newest member of the Fellowship and your support would go a really long
way to helping me help the community and the Hobby I don't know about you guys
but I sure think these new treasure tokens are a massive improvement over
the little green beads that I was using previously now don't get me wrong
using whatever you got on hand to make the game happen is totally cool and
totally fine in those little beads served us just fine in our games up
until this point but seeing these much nicer ones on the table gives me a sense
of satisfaction and I think helps with the immersion and enjoyment and even
kind of the excitement when playing a tabletop game I hope that you found this
video enjoyable entertaining most of all inspiring if you did hit that like
button and let me know in the comments section below that's it for this week
guys I will see you again next week
